block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Connecticut this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com, or by mail to Connecticut Weekly, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
Music and Dance
Greenwich Inon Barnatan, piano. Jan. 28 at 4 p.m. Free. Greenwich Library, 101 West Putnam Avenue. (203) 622-7900.
Milford Rachael Sage, piano and vocals. Friday at 8 p.m. $10. Milford Performance Coffee House, 40 Railroad Avenue South. (203) 878-6647.
New Canaan Moxie, swing ensemble. Jan. 28 at 2 p.m. Both free. New Canaan Library, 151 Main Street. (203) 594-5000.

New Haven Horowitz Piano Series, Boris Berman, piano, and Susan Narucki, soprano. Monday at 8 p.m. $10 to $18. Concert of music by Daniel Kellogg, composer, performed by Hsing-ay Hsu, piano; Jennifer Grim, flute; and the Jupiter String Quartet. Thursday at 8 p.m. Free. Sprague Hall, Yale University, College and Wall Streets. (203) 432-4158.
New Haven ''Russian White Nights,'' concert presented by the New Haven Symphony Orchestra, conducted by William Boughton. Jan. 27 at 8 p.m. $10 to $65. Woolsey Hall, Yale University. (203) 562-5666.
Ridgefield Tret Fure, folk. Jan. 28 at 7 p.m. $15 to $20. Temple Shearith Israel, 46 Peacable Street. (201) 431-6501.
Storrs Chick Corea and Gary Burton, jazz. Friday and Jan. 27 at 8 p.m. $27 to $37. Jorgensen Center for the Performing Arts, 2132 Hillside Road, University of Connecticut. (860) 486-4226.

Storrs Cello Festival 2007: Jeffrey Solow, cello, with Minyoung Lee, piano. Friday at 8 p.m. $7; students and children, free. Von der Mehden Recital Hall, , 875 Coventry Road, University of Connecticut, Storrs Campus. (860) 486-2260.

Westport A Conversation with John Corigliano, composer, and a concert of his music performed by Corigliano with Amy Burton, soprano. Friday at 8 p.m. $35; children under 18, $5. Seabury Center, 45 Church Lane. (203) 222-7070.
Wilton ''Prevailing Winds of Connecticut,'' presented by Ralph Kirmser, oboe. Jan. 28 at 4 p.m. Wilton Library, 137 Old Ridgefield Road. (203) 762-3950.
Theater
Hartford ''Fences,'' by August Wilson, directed by Jonathan Wilson. Through Feb. 11. $25 to $45. Hartford Stage, 50 Church Street. (860) 527-5151.

New Britain ''Bat Boy: The Musical'' by Keythe Farley, Brian Flemming and Laurence O'Keefe, directed by Philip D. Vetro. Through Feb. 10. $20. Hole in the Wall Theater, 116 Main Street. (860) 229-3049.
New Haven ''The Cocktail Hour'' by A. R. Gurney, directed by Kim Rubinstein. Through Feb. 4. $30 to $60. Long Wharf Theater, 222 Sargent Drive. (203) 787-4282.
New Haven ''Marat/Sade'' by Peter Weiss, directed by Nelson T. Eusebio III. Tuesday through Jan. 27. $18; seniors and students, $12. The New Theater, 1156 Chapel Street. (212) 629-2000.
Wallingford ''Winter Cabaret,'' a student production. Thursday through Jan. 28. $10; seniors, $9. Paul Mellon Arts Center, Christian Street. (203) 697-2261.
West Hartford ''Lend Me a Tenor'' by Ken Ludwig, directed by Howard Hirsch. Through Feb. 4. $25; students, $10. Park Road Playhouse, 244 Park Road. (860) 586-8500.
Westport ''The Last Journey'' by Tricia Walsh-Smith, staged reading by Peter Strauss and Laila Robins. Monday at 7 p.m. $10. Westport Country Playhouse, 25 Powers Court. (203) 227-4177.
Spoken Word
Glastonbury James Grant MacBroom, author of ''The River Book.'' Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. $10; members, $7. The Connecticut Audubon Society Center at Glastonbury, 1361 Main Street. (860) 633-8402.
Old Greenwich Barbara J. Euser, author of ''Venturing in Southern Greece: Through Villages and Vineyards.'' Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Both free. Arcadia Coffee Company, 20 Arcadia Road. (203) 637-8766.
Waterbury Candace Bushnell, author of ''Sex and the City.'' Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. $27 to $80. Palace Theater of Connecticut, 100 East Main Street. (203) 755-4700.
Comedy
Stamford Josh Blue. Friday at 8 p.m. $25 to $35. Palace Theater, Stamford Center for the Arts, 61 Atlantic Street. (203) 325-4466.
Film

Westport ''Glory,'' directed by Edward Zwick; discussion follows with Martin Haas, history professor. Jan. 21 at 2 p.m. The Overcoat Film Series: ''Talk to Her,'' directed by Pedro Almod√≥var. Wednesday at 2 p.m. Both free. Westport Public Library, 20 Jesup Road. (203) 291-4818.
For Children
Cold Spring Harbor ''Scrimshaw,'' create a keepsake box. Ages 6 to 12. Jan. 28 at 1 p.m. $7; members, $2.50; reservations required. Whaling Museum, Route 25A. (631) 367-3418.

Glastonbury ''Aquatic Mammals: Beavers,'' learn about beavers and hike to observe them. Ages 5 to 10. Tuesday at 4 p.m. ''Crazy Squirrels,'' learn about three types of squirrels and make a seed ball to feed them. Ages 3 to 5. Wednesday at 10 a.m. and 1 p.m. $13; members, $10. The Connecticut Audubon Society Center at Glastonbury, 1361 Main Street. (860) 633-8402.

Mystic ''Minerals,'' hike, learn about and search for minerals. Ages 6 and up. Monday at 3:45 p.m. ''Birds' Beaks,'' learn about what birds eat by studying their beaks and monitoring the center's feeding stations. Ages 4 and up. Tuesday at 1 p.m. ''Twig Forensics,'' learn how to decipher a tree's life story from twigs, bark and branches. Ages 4 and up. Wednesday at 1 p.m. $15; members, $12. Denison Pequotsepos Nature Center, 109 Pequotsepos Road. (860) 536-1216.
Stamford ''Native American Folktales,'' storytelling and make a dream catcher. Ages 5 to 9. Thursday at 4:15 p.m. Free; must register. Ferguson Library, 115 Vine Road. (203) 964-1000.

Stamford ''Open Season,'' animated film directed by Roger Allers, Jill Culton and Anthony Stacchi. Ages 6 and up. Friday at 4 p.m. ''Jack and the Beanstalk,'' puppet show presented by the Spring Valley Puppet Theater. Ages 5 and up. Jan. 27 at 2 p.m. Both free. Ferguson Library Main Branch, 1 Public Library Plaza. (203) 964-1000.

Wilton ''Norwalk Symphony Family Program (Not) Just For Kids, Part 3,'' opportunity to play various percussion instruments. Ages 3 to 10. Jan. 27 at 2 p.m. Free; advance registration recommended. Wilton Library, 137 Old Ridgefield Road. (203) 762-3950.
Museums and Galleries

Fairfield ''Multiple Visions: Traveling Art Boxes from Argentina, Mexico and Uruguay,'' works by more than 20 artists. Thursday through March 11. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Thomas J. Walsh Art Galley, 1073 North Benson Road. (203) 254-4000.

Middletown ''Xanadu,'' video installation by Robert Boyd. Friday through March 4. Reception: Friday, 5 to 7 p.m. Free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Ezra and Cecile Zilkha Gallery, Wesleyan University, 283 Washington Terrace. (860) 685-3355.
